text: Before 1913, the U.S. state of Idaho only had one congressional district. The last representative is republican Burton L. French. ==List of representatives== Cong ress Years Seat A Seat A Seat A Seat B Seat B Seat B Cong ress Years Representative Party Electoral history Representative Party Electoral history October 1, 1890 – March 3, 1895 Willis Sweet Republican Elected in 1890 and took seat upon statehood. Re-elected in 1890. Re-elected in 1892. Retired. March 4, 1895 – March 3, 1897 Edgar Wilson Republican Elected in 1894. Retired to run for Idaho Supreme Court. March 4, 1897 – March 3, 1899 James Gunn Populist Elected in 1896. Lost re-election. March 4, 1899 – March 3, 1901 Edgar Wilson Silver Republican Elected in 1898. Retired. March 4, 1901 – March 3, 1903 Thomas L. Glenn Populist Elected in 1900. Retired. March 4, 1903 – March 3, 1909 Burton L. French Republican Elected in 1902. Re-elected in 1904. Re-elected in 1906. Lost renomination. March 4, 1909 – March 3, 1911 Thomas Ray Hamer Republican Elected in 1908. Lost renomination. March 4, 1911 – March 3, 1913 Burton L. French Republican Elected in 1910. Re-elected in 1912. Retired to run for U.S. senator. March 3, 1913 – March 3, 1915 Burton L. French Republican Elected in 1910. Re-elected in 1912. Retired to run for U.S. senator. Addison T. Smith Republican Elected in 1912. Re-elected in 1914. Re-elected in 1916. Changed to the . March 4, 1915 – March 3, 1917 Robert M. McCracken Republican Elected in 1914. Lost renomination. Addison T. Smith Republican Elected in 1912. Re-elected in 1914. Re-elected in 1916. Changed to the . March 4, 1917 – March 3, 1919 Burton L. French Republican Elected in 1916. Changed to the . Addison T. Smith Republican Elected in 1912. Re-elected in 1914. Re-elected in 1916. Changed to the . ==References== Category:Congressional districts of Idaho
title: Idaho's at-large congressional district
